summary:
Cyrillic is a writing system used by many languages in Eurasia. It's the official script in many Slavic and other countries. Over 250 million people use it, with Russia having the largest population. Cyrillic became an official EU script when Bulgaria joined in 2007.

The alphabet was created in the 9th century in Bulgaria, likely by followers of Cyril and Methodius, who also invented the Glagolitic script. The name "Cyrillic" honors Saint Cyril.
title: Cyrillic script
